intro: Cunigunda purpurea, commonly known as the purple cunigunda, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its striking purple to pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features heart-shaped, lobed leaves with a velvety texture. Native to Europe, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun conditions. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
